content.text:
# Draft:Peralta Hacienda Historical Park

Peralta Hacienda Historical Parkis a 6-acre historical site in Oakland, California'a Fruitdale neighborhood.
The Peralta family arrived with Juan Bautista de Anza's 1776 expedition from Spain seeking to colonize the area. Forty years later, the family was granted about 45,000 acres in the area. They raised cattle, pemons, grapes and almonds.
The museum won a national medal for museum and library services in 2017. Federal funding for it was cut in 2025.
Murals at the park show residents of different ethnic backgrounds.
Peralta Hacienda Historical House
Peralta Home
Peralta House Museum
The site was part of a much larger Spanish land grant. It was the subject of court cases upholding it and family legal disputes over ownership.
